text.sanskrit: अबोध्यग्निः समिधा जनानां प्रति धेनुमिवायतीमुषासं ।यह्वा इव प्र वयामुज्जिहानाः प्र भानवः सिस्रते नाकमच्छ ॥

translations.text: Agniis awakened by the fuel (supplied) by the priests at the dawn, approaching like a cow (to pasture); his flames rise up to the sky like stately (trees) throwing aloft their branches.

text.sanskrit: अबोधि होता यजथाय देवानूर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः प्रातरस्थात् ।समिद्धस्य रुशददर्शि पाजो महांदेवस्तमसो निरमोचि ॥
text.iast: abodhi  hotā  yajathāya  devān  ūrdhvaḥ  agníḥ  su-manāḥ  prātaḥ  asthāt sam-iddhasya  ruśat  adarśi  pājaḥ  mahān  devaḥ  tamasaḥ  níḥ  amoci ||

translations.text: The offer of the oblation is awakened for the worship of the gods; favourably minded,Agnihas rise up with the dawn; the radiant vigour of the kindled (fire) is manifested; the great deity has been liberated from the darkness.

text.sanskrit: यदीं गणस्य रशनामजीगः शुचिरंक्ते शुचिभिर्गोभिरग्निः ।आद्दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयंत्युत्तानामूर्ध्वो अधयज्जुहूभिः ॥

translations.text: WhenAgnihas seized upon the (confining) girdle of the aggregated (world), then, bright-shining, he makes all manifest with brilliant rays; thereupon the precious food-desiring (oblations) is added (to the flame), and Agni, soaring aloft, drinks it as it is (spread out) recumbent by the ladles.

translations.text: The minds of the devout turn toAgni, as the eyes (of men) look towards the sun; when the multiform (heaven and earth) bring him forth along with the dawn, he is born as a white courser in the beginning of the days.

translations.text: (Agni), capable of birth, is born in the beginning of the days; radiant, he is deposited in the friendly woods, and then the adorable Agni, the offerer of the oblation, displaying seven precious (rays), is seated in every house.

text.sanskrit: कुमारं माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे ।अनीकमस्य न मिनज्जनासः पुरः पश्यंति निहितमरतौ ॥

translations.text: The young mother cherishes her mutilated boy in secret, and gives him not up to the father; men behold not his mutilated form, but (see him) when plural ced before (them) in an unresting (position).

translations.text: Young mother, what boy is this whom you, (become) a malevolent spirit, foster? The mighty (queen) has given him birth; the embryo has thrived through many years; I have seen him born as the mother brought him forth.

text.sanskrit: उत स्वानासो दिवि षंत्वग्नेस्तिग्मायुधा रक्षसे हंतवा उ ।मदे चिदस्य प्र रुजंति भामा न वरंते परिबाधो अदेवीः ॥

text.sanskrit: अस्माकमग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व सहसः सूनो त्रिषधस्थ हव्यं ।वयं देवेषु सुकृतः स्याम शर्मणा नस्त्रिवरूथेन पाहि ॥

text.sanskrit: विश्वानि नो दुर्गहा जातवेदः सिंधुं न नावा दुरिताति पर्षि ।अग्ने अत्रिवन्नमसा गृणानोऽस्माकं बोध्यविता तनूनां ॥

translations.text: You convey us,Jātavedas, across all intolerable evils, as (people are carried) over a river by a boat;Agni, who are glorified by us with reverence, such as (that shown) byAtri, know yourself the protector of our person ns.

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्न ऋतायवः समीधिरे प्रत्नं प्रत्नास ऊतये सहस्कृत ।पुरुश्चंद्रं यजतं विश्वधायसं दमूनसं गृहपतिं वरेण्यं ॥
text.iast: tvām  agne  ṛta-yavaḥ  sam  īdhire  pratnam  pratnāsaḥ  ūtaye  sahaḥ-kṛta puru-candram  yajatam  viśva-dhāyasam  damūnasam  gṛha-patim  vareṇyam ||

translations.text: Manifest of strength,Agni, ancient worshippers have kindled you of old for their preservation; you, the delighter of many, the adorable, the all-sustaining, the lowly-minded, the lord of the house, the excellent.

text.iast: tvām  agne  atithim  pūrvyam  víśaḥ  śocíḥ-keśam  gṛha-patim  ní  sedire bṛhat-ketum  puru-rūpam  dhana-spṛtam  su-śarmāṇam  su-avasam  jarat-víṣam ||

text.sanskrit: त्वामग्ने मानुषीरीळते विशो होत्राविदं विविचिं रत्नधातमं ।गुहा संतं सुभग विश्वदर्शतं तुविष्वणसं सुयजं घृतश्रियं ॥

translations.text: Agni, the praised of many, you who are multiform, giver of old food to every mortal; you reign with strength over the various (sacrificial) viands; the splendour of you when blazing brightly is not rivalled (by any).

text.sanskrit: त्वं नो अग्ने अद्भुत क्रत्वा दक्षस्य मंहना ।त्वे असुर्यमारुहत्क्राणा मित्रो न यज्ञियः ॥

translations.text: MarvellousAgni, (gratified) by our acts, (produce) in us greatness of vigour; in you abides the strength destroying evil spirits; you who are to be worshipped likeMitra, are the doer (of great deeds).

text.sanskrit: त्वं नो अग्न एषां गयं पुष्टिं च वर्धय ।ये स्तोमेभिः प्र सूरयो नरो मघान्यानशुः ॥

translations.text: Augment,Agni, our dwelling and prosperity, for the devout men (who have propitiated you) by their praises have acquired riches.

translations.text: DelightfulAgni, those men who glorify you with hymns become rich in horses, and are invigorated with (foe-destroying) energies; and their great renown, spread through the firmament arouses (you) of your own accord.

text.sanskrit: नू नो अग्न ऊतये सबाधसश्च रातये ।अस्माकासश्च सूरयो विश्वा आशास्तरीषणि ॥

text.sanskrit: त्वं नो अग्ने अंगिरः स्तुतः स्तवान आ भर ।होतर्विभ्वासहं रयिं स्तोतृभ्यः स्तवसे च न उतैधि पृत्सु नो वृधे ॥

translations.text: Agni, who areAṅgiras, glorified in the past, glorified (at present), invoker (of the gods), bring unto us riches (enabling us) to overcome the mighty; give to your praisers (ability) to praise you, and be (athand) for our success in battles.

text.sanskrit: जनस्य गोपा अजनिष्ट जागृविरग्निः सुदक्षः सुविताय नव्यसे ।घृतप्रतीको बृहता दिविस्पृशा द्युमद्वि भाति भरतेभ्यः शुचिः ॥

translations.text: The vigilant, the powerfulAgni, the protector of man, has been engendered for the present prosperity (of the world); fed with butter, (blazing) with intense (radiance) reaching to the sky, the pure Agni shines brilliantly for theBharatas.

text.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुं प्रथमं पुरोहितमग्निं नरस्त्रिषधस्थे समीधिरे ।इंद्रेण देवैः सरथं स बर्हिषि सीदन्नि होता यजथाय सुक्रतुः ॥

translations.text: The priests have first kindled, in three plural ces,Agni, the banner of sacrifice, the family priests, (riding) in the same car withIndraand the gods; he, the performer of pious acts, the invoker (of the gods), has sat down on the sacred grass for the (celebration of the) rite.

text.sanskrit: असम्मृष्टो जायसे मात्रोः शुचिर्मंद्रः कविरुदतिष्ठो विवस्वतः ।घृतेन त्वावर्धयन्नग्न आहुत धूमस्ते केतुरभवद्दिवि श्रितः ॥

translations.text: You are born unobstructed of two mothers; pure, adorable, wise, you have sprung up from (the devotion of) the householder; they have augmented you with butter;Agni, to whom burnt-offerings are made, the smoke is your banner spread abroad in the sky.

text.sanskrit: अग्निर्नो यज्ञमुप वेतु साधुयाग्निं नरो वि भरंते गृहेगृहे ।अग्निर्दूतो अभवद्धव्यवाहनोऽग्निं वृणाना वृणते कविक्रतुं ॥

translations.text: MayAgni, the fulfiller (of all desires) come to our sacrifice; men cherish Agni in every dwelling; Agni, the bearer of oblations, has become the messenger (of the gods); those adoring Agni adore him as the accomplisher of the sacrifice.

translations.text: Agni, bestower of water, by what (act of) truth may you, who are adorable, be cognizant of our adoration; may the divine Agni, the guardian of the seasons, recognize me; (I know) him not (yet) as the lord of the riches of which I am the possessor.

text.sanskrit: वि षू मृधो जनुषा दानमिन्वन्नहन्गवा मघवन्त्संचकानः ।अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यदवर्तयो मनवे गातुमिच्छन् ॥

translations.text: Indra, oḥ people, has come to see you, wishing to behold his friend the offerer of the libation; let us creaking stones, for whose rotation the priests hasten, supply the altar.

translations.text: Immortal (Indra), let not the more wishing, anxiously wishing for you, fall into sin; be indeed plural ased with the sacrificers, and grant vigour to those men among whom may we be (especially) yours.

translations.text: You have discovered,Indra, by his acts, the secret vital part of him who thought himself invulnerable, when, powerful Indra, in the exhilaration of theSoma, they have detected him preparing for combat in his dark abode.

text.sanskrit: उद्यदिंद्रो महते दानवाय वधर्यमिष्ट सहो अप्रतीतं ।यदीं वज्रस्य प्रभृतौ ददाभ विश्वस्य जंतोरधमं चकार ॥

text.sanskrit: को अस्य शुष्मं तविषीं वरात एको धना भरते अप्रतीतः ।इमे चिदस्य ज्रयसो नु देवी इंद्रस्यौजसो भियसा जिहाते ॥

translations.text: Who may resist the withering might of thatIndra; he, single and irresistible, carries off the riches (of the enemy); these two divine (beings, heaven and earth), proceed swiftly through fear of the strength of the quick-moving Indra.

text.sanskrit: न्यस्मै देवी स्वधितिर्जिहीत इंद्राय गातुरुशतीव येमे ।सं यदोजो युवते विश्वमाभिरनु स्वधाव्ने क्षितयो नमंत ॥

translations.text: The divine, self-sustaining (heaven) comes to him; the moving (earth), like a loving (wife), resigns herself toIndra; when he shares all his vigour with these (his people), then, in due succession, men offer reverence to the potent Indra.

translations.text: When,Indra, you were dissipating those illusions ofSvarbhānuwhich were spread below the sun, thenAtri, by his fourth sacred prayer, discovered the sun concealed by the darkness impeding his functions.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तां वो देवाः सुमतिमूर्जयंतीमिषमश्याम वसवः शसा गोः ।सा नः सुदानुर्मृळयंती देवी प्रति द्रवंती सुविताय गम्याः ॥
text.iast: tām  vaḥ  devāḥ  su-matím  ūrjayantīm  íṣam  aśyāma  vasavaḥ  śasā  goḥ sā  naḥ  su-dānuḥ  mṛḷayantī  devī  prati  dravantī  suvitāya  gamyāḥ ||

translations.text: DivineVasus, may we obtain from the adorable cow invigorating and mind-sustaining food; may that liberal and benignant goddess, hastening (I, her), come for our felicity.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

translations.text: May Iḷā, the mother of the herd, andUrvaśīwith the rivers, be favourable to us; may the bright-shining Urvaśī (come), commanding our devotion, and investing the worshipper with light.

text.sanskrit: प्र शंतमा वरुणं दीधिती गीर्मित्रं भगमदितिं नूनमश्याः ।पृषद्योनिः पंचहोता शृणोत्वतूर्तपंथा असुरो मयोभुः ॥
text.iast: pra  śam-tamā  varuṇam  dīdhitī  gīḥ  mitram  bhagam  aditim  nūnam  aśyāḥ pṛṣat-yoniḥ  pañca-hotā  śṛṇotu  atūrta-panthāḥ  asuraḥ  mayaḥ-bhuḥ ||

translations.text: May our most animating praise, together with our offerings, successfully attainVaruṇa,Mitra,BhagaandAditi; may the ministrant of the five (vital airs,Vāyu), the dweller in the dappled (firmament), he whose path is unimpeded, who is the giver of life, the bestower of happiness, hear.

text.sanskrit: समिंद्र णो मनसा नेषि गोभिः सं सूरिभिर्हरिवः सं स्वस्ति ।सं ब्रह्मणा देवहितं यदस्ति सं देवानां सुमत्या यज्ञियानां ॥

translations.text: With a (willing) mind,Indra, you associate us with cattle, with pious (priests) and, lord of steeds, with prosperity, with (sacrificial) food that is agreeable to the gods, and with the favour of the adorable deities.

text.sanskrit: देवो भगः सविता रायो अंश इंद्रो वृत्रस्य संजितो धनानां ।ऋभुक्षा वाज उत वा पुरंधिरवंतु नो अमृतासस्तुरासः ॥

text.sanskrit: मरुत्वतो अप्रतीतस्य जिष्णोरजूर्यतः प्र ब्रवामा कृतानि ।न ते पूर्वे मघवन्नापरासो न वीर्यं नूतनः कश्चनाप ॥
text.iast: marutvataḥ  aprati-itasya  jiṣṇoḥ  ajūryataḥ  pra  bravāma  kṛtāni na  te  pūrve  magha-van  na  aparāsaḥ  na  vīryam  nūtanaḥ  kaḥ  cana  āpa ||

translations.text: We celebrate the exploits of Marutvat, the unrecoiling, the victorious, the undecaying; neither the ancients,Maghavan, nor their successors, have attained your prowess, nor has any one recent attained it.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: विसर्माणं कृणुहि वित्तमेषां ये भुंजते अपृणंतो न उक्थैः ।अपव्रतान्प्रसवे वावृधानान्ब्रह्मद्विषः सूर्याद्यावयस्व ॥

translations.text: Render transitory the riches of those who partake of enjoyment without giving satisfaction (to those who are eminent) by holy hymns; put apart from the sun those who perform not sacred rites, and who, though prospering in their posterity, are the adversaries of prayer.

text.sanskrit: य ओहते रक्षसो देववीतावचक्रेभिस्तं मरुतो नि यात ।यो वः शमीं शशमानस्य निंदात्तुच्छ्यान्कामान्करते सिष्विदानः ॥

translations.text: Send,Maruts, into darkness with (cars) devoid of wheels, the man who invites therākṣasasto the food of the gods; (him also) who reviles me when offering praise to you; while sweating, he toils (to realize) vain desires.

text.sanskrit: न स जीयते मरुतो न हन्यते न स्रेधति न व्यथते न रिष्यति ।नास्य राय उप दस्यंति नोतय ऋषिं वा यं राजानं वा सुषूदथ ॥
text.iast: na  saḥ  jīyate  marutaḥ  na  hanyate  na  sredhati  na  vyathate  na  riṣyati na  asya  rāyaḥ  upa  dasyanti  na  ūtayaḥ  ṛṣim  vā  yam  rājānam  vā  susūdatha ||

translations.text: The sage, or the sovereign, whom you,Maruts, direct, is never overcome nor slain; he perishes not, nor suffers pain, nor undergoes injury, nor are his riches or his safety imperilled.

text.sanskrit: नियुत्वंतो ग्रामजितो यथा नरोऽर्यमणो न मरुतः कबंधिनः ।पिन्वंत्युत्सं यदिनासो अस्वरन्व्युंदंति पृथिवीं मध्वो अंधसा ॥

translations.text: Lords of theNiyutsteeds, overcomers of multitudes leaders (of rites), radiant as theĀdityas, are the dispensers of water; when sovereign lords, they fill the clouds, and, loud sounding, moisten the earth with sweet (watery) sustenance.

text.sanskrit: प्रवत्वतीयं पृथिवी मरुद्भ्यः प्रवत्वती द्यौर्भवति प्रयद्भ्यः ।प्रवत्वतीः पथ्या अंतरिक्ष्याः प्रवत्वंतः पर्वता जीरदानवः ॥

translations.text: This wide-extended earth is for theMaruts; the spacious heaven is for the spreading winds; the paths of the firmament are provided (for their course); for them the expanding clouds quickly bestow (their gifts).

text.sanskrit: यन्मरुतः सभरसः स्वर्णरः सूर्य उदिते मदथा दिवो नरः ।न वोऽश्वाः श्रथयंताह सिस्रतः सद्यो अस्याध्वनः पारमश्नुथ ॥

translations.text: Marutsof combined strength, leaders of the universe, guides of heaven, when the sun has risen you rejoice (in theSomabeverage), then your rapid steeds know no relaxation, but quickly you reach the limits of this road (to the sacrifice).

text.sanskrit: अंसेषु व ऋष्टयः पत्सु खादयो वक्षःसु रुक्मा मरुतो रथे शुभः ।अग्निभ्राजसो विद्युतो गभस्त्योः शिप्राः शीर्षसु वितता हिरण्ययीः ॥

translations.text: Lances (gleam),Maruts, upon your shoulders, anklets on your feet, golden cuirasses on your breasts, and pure (waters shine) in your chariots; lightning blazing with fire in yourhands, and golden tiarsa are towering on your heads.

text.sanskrit: तं नाकमर्यो अगृभीतशोचिषं रुशत्पिप्पलं मरुतो वि धूनुथ ।समच्यंत वृजनातित्विषंत यत्स्वरंति घोषं विततमृतायवः ॥

translations.text: Maruts, when moving, you agitate the heaven of unchecked radiance, and (stir) the bright water; when you combine your energies and are shining brilliantly, and when purposing to send down rain, you utter a loud shout.

text.sanskrit: युष्मादत्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रायः स्याम रथ्यो वयस्वतः ।न यो युच्छति तिष्यो यथा दिवोऽस्मे रारंत मरुतः सहस्रिणं ॥
text.iast: yuṣmā-dattasya  marutaḥ  vi-cetasaḥ  rāyaḥ  syāma  rathyaḥ  vayasvataḥ na  yaḥ  yucchati  tiṣyaḥ  yathā  divaḥ  asme íti  raranta  marutaḥ  sahasríṇam ||

translations.text: May we, who are possessed of chariots, intelligentMaruts, become (proprietors) of wealth, comprising food bestowed by you; of wealth that vanishes not, asTiṣya(declines not) from the sky; therefore, Maruts, gratify us with infinite (riches).

text.sanskrit: यूयं रयिं मरुतः स्पार्हवीरं यूयमृषिमवथ सामविप्रं ।यूयमर्वंतं भरताय वाजं यूयं धत्थ राजानं श्रुष्टिमंतं ॥

translations.text: You bestow,Maruts, wealth and enviable posterity; you protect the sage learned in theSāma; you grant horses and food to (me) the ministrant priest; you render a prince prosperous.

text.sanskrit: तद्वो यामि द्रविणं सद्यऊतयो येना स्वर्ण ततनाम नॄँरभि ।इदं सु मे मरुतो हर्यता वचो यस्य तरेम तरसा शतं हिमाः ॥
text.iast: tat  vaḥ  yāmi  draviṇam  sadyaḥ-ūtayaḥ  yena  svaḥ  na  tatanāma  nṝn  abhí idam  su  me  marutaḥ  haryata  vacaḥ  yasya  tarema  tarasā  śatam  hímāḥ ||

translations.text: Therefore do I solicit wealth of you, who are prompt to grant protection, whereby we may multiply our descendants, as the sun (spreads wide his rays); be propitiated,Maruts, by this my praise, by the efficacy whereof may we pass over a hundred winters.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: प्रयज्यवो मरुतो भ्राजदृष्टयो बृहद्वयो दधिरे रुक्मवक्षसः ।ईयंते अश्वैः सुयमेभिराशुभिः शुभं यातामनु रथा अवृत्सत ॥

text.sanskrit: सम्राजा उग्रा वृषभा दिवस्पती पृथिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी ।चित्रेभिरभ्रैरुप तिष्ठथो रवं द्यां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया ॥
text.iast: sam-rājau  ugrā  vṛṣabhā  divaḥ  patī íti  pṛthivyāḥ  mitrāvaruṇā  vícarṣaṇī íti ví-carṣaṇī citrebhiḥ  abhraiḥ  upa  tiṣṭhathaḥ  ravam  dyām  varṣayathaḥ  asurasya  māyayā ||

translations.text: Imperial and mighty showerers, lords of heaven and earth, beholders of the universe, you approach,MitraandVaruṇa, with variegated clouds to hear the sound (of your praises), and cause the sky to (send down) rain by the power of the emitter of showers.

text.sanskrit: माया वां मित्रावरुणा दिवि श्रिता सूर्यो ज्योतिश्चरति चित्रमायुधं ।तमभ्रेण वृष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य द्रप्सा मधुमंत ईरते ॥
text.iast: māyā  vām  mitrāvaruṇā  diví  śritā  sūryaḥ  jyotiḥ  carati  citram  āyudham tam  abhreṇa  vṛṣṭyā  gūhathaḥ  diví  parjanya  drapsāḥ  madhu-mantaḥ  īrate ||

translations.text: Your deevice,MitraandVaruṇa, is manifested in heaven, when the light (that is) the sun, your wonderful weapon, moves (in the firmament); him you invest in the sky with the cloud (and) with rain; and (your) sweet drops,Parjanya, fall (at their desire).

text.sanskrit: रथं युंजते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु ।रजांसि चित्रा वि चरंति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतं ॥
text.iast: ratham  yuñjate  marutaḥ  śubhe  su-kham  śūraḥ  na  mitrāvaruṇā  go-iṣṭiṣu rajāṃsi  citrā  ví  caranti  tanyavaḥ  divaḥ  sam-rājā  payasā  naḥ  ukṣatam ||

translations.text: TheMarutsharness their easy-going chariot,MitraandVaruṇa, for (the emission of) water, as a hero (harnesses his war-car); their forms traverse the different spheres to distribute the rain; do you, therefore, supreme rulers, shed upon us water from heaven.

translations.text: Discerning, sagacious,MitraandVaruṇa, by your office you protect pious rites, through the power of the emitter of showers; you illumine the whole world with water; you sustain the sun, the adorable chariot in the sky.

text.sanskrit: अभूदुषा रुशत्पशुराग्निरधाय्यृत्वियः ।अयोजि वां वृषण्वसू रथो दस्रावमर्त्यो माध्वी मम श्रुतं हवं ॥
text.iast: abhūt  uṣāḥ  ruśat-paśuḥ  ā  agníḥ  adhāyi  ṛtvíyaḥ ayoji  vām  vṛṣaṇvasū íti vṛṣaṇ-vasū  rathaḥ  dasrau  amartyaḥ  mādhvī íti  mama  śrutam  havam ||

translations.text: The dawn has come; theAgniof the season, blazing with the oblation has been plural ced (upon the altar); showerers of wealth, subduers of foes, your immortal chariot has been harnessed; masters of mystic lore, hear my invocation.

text.sanskrit: आ भात्यग्निरुषसामनीकमुद्विप्राणां देवया वाचो अस्थुः ।अर्वांचा नूनं रथ्येह यातं पीपिवांसमश्विना घर्ममच्छ ॥

translations.text: Agnilight sup the face of the dawns; the devout praisers of the pious have risen up; therefore,Aśvins, lords of the chariot, descending, come hither today to the splendid sacrifice, perfect (in all its parts).

text.sanskrit: न संस्कृतं प्र मिमीतो गमिष्ठांति नूनमश्विनोपस्तुतेह ।दिवाभिपित्वेऽवसागमिष्ठा प्रत्यवर्तिं दाशुषे शंभविष्ठा ॥
text.iast: na  saṃskṛtam  pra  mimītaḥ  gamiṣṭhā  anti  nūnam  aśvínā  upa-stutā  iha dívā  abhi-pitve  avasā  ā-gamiṣṭhā  prati  avartim  dāśuṣe  śam-bhaviṣṭhā ||

translations.text: Harm not,Aśvins, the perfected (rite), but coming now most quickly, be glorified on this occasion; be present at the opening of the ay, with proection against destitution, and be prompt to bestow happiness upon the donor (of the offering).

text.sanskrit: उता यातं संगवे प्रातरह्नो मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य ।दिवा नक्तमवसा शंतमेन नेदानीं पीतिरश्विना ततान ॥
text.iast: uta  ā  yātam  sam-gave  prātaḥ  ahnaḥ  madhyandine  ut-itā  sūryasya dívā  naktam  avasā  śam-tamena  na  idānīm  pītíḥ  aśvínā  ā  tatāna ||

translations.text: Whether you come at the (milking time) of the cattle, at the dawn of day, at noon, when the sun is high, or by day or by night, (come) with felicitious protection; the drinking of theSomahas not now extended beyond theAśvins. (whether you come: the day is divisible into two, three, five or fifteen parts; here the five-fold distinction is alluded to: uditā sūryasya = the afternoon, atyantapravṛddhasamayaḥaparāhṇaityarthaḥ; the drinking of the soma...Aśvins: nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna: legend-- the other gods refused to admit the participation of the Aśvins in the Soma libation at these hours, but on the present occasion they are not passed over; idānim api itaradevānām pānam na tanotyaśvinau vihāya, but now the drinking of the other gods does not extend, having omitted the two Aśvins]
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: समश्विनोरवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम ।आ नो रयिं वहतमोत वीराना विश्वान्यमृता सौभगानि ॥

text.sanskrit: प्रातर्यावाणा प्रथमा यजध्वं पुरा गृध्रादररुषः पिबातः ।प्रातर्हि यज्ञमश्विना दधाते प्र शंसंति कवयः पूर्वभाजः ॥

translations.text: Worship the two who come first (of the gods) at dawn; let them drink before the greedy withholders (of the offering); for theAśvinsverily claim the morning sacrifice; the ardent sages praised them (at dawn).

translations.text: The offerers of oblations who eulogize you, lustrous Uṣas, with sacred hymns, become prosperous with affluence, (through your favour), bestower of wealth, bright-born goddess, (who are) sincrely praised for (the gift of) horses.

translations.text: These, your assembled (worshippers), who stand before you to distribute wealth, entertain towards us kindly intentions, offering unlimited riches; bright-born goddess, (who are) sincerely praised for (the gift of) horses.

translations.text: Affluent Uṣas, bestow upon these (yor) devout adorers food and posterity, so that, being opulent, they may, without stint, bestow riches upon us; bright-born goddess who are sincerely praised for (the gift of) horses.

text.sanskrit: एषा जनं दर्शता बोधयंती सुगान्पथः कृण्वती यात्यग्रे ।बृहद्रथा बृहती विश्वमिन्वोषा ज्योतिर्यच्छत्यग्रे अह्नां ॥

translations.text: The lovely Dawn, arousing man, goes before (the sun) preparing practicable paths, riding in a spacious chariot; vast, expanding everywhere, she diffuses light at the commencement of the days.

text.sanskrit: कितवासो यद्रिरिपुर्न दीवि यद्वा घा सत्यमुत यन्न विद्म ।सर्वा ता वि ष्य शिथिरेव देवाधा ते स्याम वरुण प्रियासः ॥
text.iast: kitavāsaḥ  yat  riripuḥ  na  dīví  yat  vā  gha  satyam  uta  yat  na  vidma sarvā  tā  ví  sya  śithirā-iva  deva  adha  te  syāma  varuṇa  priyāsaḥ ||

translations.text: If, like gamesters, who cheat at plural y, (we commit offences) knowingly, or (those) of which we know not, do you divineVaruṇa, extricate us from them all, as if from loosened (bonds), so that we may be dear, Varuṇa, to you.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इंद्राग्नी यमवथ उभा वाजेषु मर्त्यं ।दृळ्हा चित्स प्र भेदति द्युम्ना वाणीरिव त्रितः ॥
text.iast: índrāgnī íti  yam  avathaḥ  ubhā  vājeṣu  martyam dṛḷhā  cit  saḥ  pra  bhedati  dyumnā  vāṇīḥ-iva  tritaḥ ||

translations.text: IndraandAgni, the mortal whom you both protect scatters the substantial treasures (of his enemies), asTrita(fonfutes) the words (of his opponents).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: या पृतनासु दुष्टरा या वाजेषु श्रवाय्या ।या पंच चर्षणीरभींद्राग्नी ता हवामहे ॥
text.iast: yā  pṛtanāsu  dustarā  yā  vājeṣu  śravāyyā yā  pañca  carṣaṇīḥ  abhí  indrāgnī íti  tā  havāmahe ||

translations.text: We invoke the two,IndraandAgni, who are irresistible in conflicts, who are renowned in battles, who protect the five (classes of) men.

text.sanskrit: तयोरिदमवच्छवस्तिग्मा दिद्युन्मघोनोः ।प्रति द्रुणा गभस्त्योर्गवां वृत्रघ्न एषते ॥
text.iast: tayoḥ  ít  ama-vat  śavaḥ  tigmā  didyut  maghonoḥ prati  druṇā  gabhastyoḥ  gavām  vṛtra-ghne  ā  īṣate ||

translations.text: Overpowering is the might of these two; the bright (lightning) is shining in thehandsofMaghavan, as they go toether in one chariot for the (recovery of the) cows and the destruction ofVṛtra.

text.sanskrit: ता वामेषे रथानामिंद्राग्नी हवामहे ।पती तुरस्य राधसो विद्वांसा गिर्वणस्तमा ॥
text.iast: ā  vām  eṣe  rathānām  indrāgnī íti  havāmahe patī íti  turasya  rādhasaḥ  vidvāṃsā  gírvaṇaḥ-tamā ||

translations.text: We invoke you both,IndraandAgni, for (sending) your chariots to the combat, lords of moveable wealth, all-knowing, most deserving of praise.

text.sanskrit: ता वृधंतावनु द्यून्मर्ताय देवावदभा ।अर्हंता चित्पुरो दधेऽंशेव देवावर्वते ॥
text.iast: tā  vṛdhantau  anu  dyūn  martāya  devau  adabhā arhantā  cit  puraḥ  dadhe  aṃśā-iva  devau  arvate ||

translations.text: I adore you, irresistible deities for (the sake of obtaining) horses; you who are increasing day by day like mortals, who are worthy of worship, like twoĀdityas.

text.sanskrit: एवेंद्राग्निभ्यामहावि हव्यं शूष्यं घृतं न पूतमद्रिभिः ।ता सूरिषु श्रवो बृहद्रयिं गृणत्सु दिधृतमिषं गृणत्सु दिधृतं ॥
text.iast: eva  indrāgní-bhyām  ahāvi  havyam  śūṣyam  ghṛtam  na  pūtam  adri-bhiḥ tā  sūríṣu  śravaḥ  bṛhat  rayím  gṛṇat-su  didhṛtam  íṣam  gṛṇat-su  didhṛtam ||

translations.text: The invigorating oblation has been offered, like theSoma-juice expressed by the sounding stones; do you bestow food uponthe pious; great riches upon those who praise you; bestow food also upon those who praise you.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: प्र वो महे मतयो यंतु विष्णवे मरुत्वते गिरिजा एवयामरुत् ।प्र शर्धाय प्रयज्यवे सुखादये तवसे भंददिष्टये धुनिव्रताय शवसे ॥
text.iast: pra  vaḥ  mahe  matayaḥ  yantu  víṣṇave  marutvate  giri-jāḥ  evayāmarut pra  śardhāya  pra-yajyave  su-khādaye  tavase  bhandat-iṣṭaye  dhuni-vratāya  śavase ||

translations.text: May the voice-born praises of Evayāmarut reach you,Viṣṇu, attended by theMaruts; (may they reach) the strong, the adorable, the brilliantly-adorned, the vigorous, praise-loving, cloud-scattering, quick-moving company of the Maruts.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: प्र ये जाता महिना ये च नु स्वयं प्र विद्मना ब्रुवत एवयामरुत् ।क्रत्वा तद्वो मरुतो नाधृषे शवो दाना मह्ना तदेषामधृष्टासो नाद्रयः ॥
text.iast: pra  ye  jātāḥ  mahinā  ye  ca  nu  svayam  pra  vidmanā  bruvate  evayāmarut kratvā  tat  vaḥ  marutaḥ  na  ā-dhṛṣe  śavaḥ  dānā  mahnā  tat  eṣām  adhṛṣṭāsaḥ  na  adrayaḥ ||

translations.text: Evayāmarut glorifies those who are manifested with the great (Indra), who appear spontaneously and speedily with the knowledge (that the sacrifice is prepared); your strength in action,Maruts, is not to be resisted, (though qualified) by (your) infinite liberality; you are immoveable as mountains.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: प्र ये दिवो बृहतः शृण्विरे गिरा सुशुक्वानः सुभ्व एवयामरुत् ।न येषामिरी सधस्थ ईष्ट आँ अग्नयो न स्वविद्युतः प्र स्यंद्रासो धुनीनां ॥
text.iast: pra  ye  divaḥ  bṛhataḥ  śṛṇvire  girā  su-śukvānaḥ  su-bhvaḥ  evayāmarut na  yeṣām  írī  sadha-sthe  īṣṭe  ā  agnayaḥ  na  sva-vidyutaḥ  pra  syandrāsaḥ  dhunīnām ||

translations.text: Evayāmarut, glorifies with praise those who, (coming) brilliant and happy from the vast heaven, hear (his invocation); in whose dwelling there is no one able to disturb them, and who, like self-radiant fires, are the impellers of the rivers.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स चक्रमे महतो निरुरुक्रमः समानस्मात्सदस एवयामरुत् ।यदायुक्त त्मना स्वादधि ष्णुभिर्विष्पर्धसो विमहसो जिगाति शेवृधो नृभिः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  cakrame  mahataḥ  níḥ  uru-kramaḥ  samānasmāt  sadasaḥ  evayāmarut yadā  ayukta  tmanā  svāt  adhi  snu-bhiḥ  ví-spardhasaḥ  ví-mahasaḥ  jígāti  śe-vṛdhaḥ  nṛ-bhiḥ ||

translations.text: That wide-spreading troop (ofMaruts) has issued from a spacious common dwelling-plural ce, (where) evayāmarut (awaits them) when their car has been spontaneously harnessed with its rapid horses; and, emulous, vigorous, and conferring happiness, they sally forth.

text.sanskrit: स्वनो न वोऽमवान्रेजयद्वृषा त्वेषो ययिस्तविष एवयामरुत् ।येना सहंत ऋंजत स्वरोचिषः स्थारश्मानो हिरण्ययाः स्वायुधास इष्मिणः ॥
text.iast: svanaḥ  na  vaḥ  ama-vān  rejayat  vṛṣā  tveṣaḥ  yayíḥ  taviṣaḥ  evayāmarut yena  sahantaḥ  ṛñjata  sva-rociṣaḥ  sthāḥ-raśmānaḥ  hiraṇyayāḥ  su-āyudhāsaḥ  iṣmíṇaḥ ||

translations.text: Let not the sound (of your approach,Maruts), which is mighty, the announcer of rain,t he shedder of light, diffusive, loud, alarm Evayāmarut; that sound wherewith, overcoming (your foes), you who are self-irradiating, lasting-rayed, ornamented with golden oranaments, self-weaponed, bestowing food, accomplish your functions.

text.sanskrit: अपारो वो महिमा वृद्धशवसस्त्वेषं शवोऽवत्वेवयामरुत् ।स्थातारो हि प्रसितौ संदृशि स्थन ते न उरुष्यता निदः शुशुक्वांसो नाग्नयः ॥
text.iast: apāraḥ  vaḥ  mahimā  vṛddha-śavasaḥ  tveṣam  śavaḥ  avatu  evayāmarut sthātāraḥ  hí  pra-sitau  sam-dṛśi  sthana  te  naḥ  uruṣyata  nidaḥ  śuśukvāṃsaḥ  na  agnayaḥ ||

translations.text: Possessor of vast strength, may your unbounded greatness, your brilliant vigour, protect Evayāmarut; for you are the regulators for overseeing (what is fit for) the limits of the sacrifice; preserve us from those who revile us, you, who are like blazing fires.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ते रुद्रासः सुमखा अग्नयो यथा तुविद्युम्ना अवंत्वेवयामरुत् ।दीर्घं पृथु पप्रथे सद्म पार्थिवं येषामज्मेष्वा महः शर्धांस्यद्भुतैनसां ॥
text.iast: te  rudrāsaḥ  su-makhāḥ  agnayaḥ  yathā  tuvi-dyumnāḥ  avantu  evayāmarut dīrgham  pṛthu  paprathe  sadma  pārthivam  yeṣām  ajmeṣu  ā  mahaḥ  śardhāṃsi  adbhuta-enasām ||

translations.text: May thoseRudras, the objects of worship, like resplendent fires, protect Evayāmarut; they, whose ethereal dwelling, extended and wide, has been made illustrious (by them), and of whom, exempt from blame, the mighty energies (are manifested) in their courses.

text.sanskrit: अद्वेषो नो मरुतो गातुमेतन श्रोता हवं जरितुरेवयामरुत् ।विष्णोर्महः समन्यवो युयोतन स्मद्रथ्यो न दंसनाप द्वेषांसि सनुतः ॥
text.iast: adveṣaḥ  naḥ  marutaḥ  gātum  ā  itana  śrota  havam  jarituḥ  evayāmarut víṣṇoḥ  mahaḥ  sa-manyavaḥ  yuyotana  smat  rathyaḥ  na  daṃsanā  apa  dveṣāṃsi  sanutaríti ||

translations.text: Maruts, devoid of enmity, come to our proffered praise, hear the invocation of your adorer, Evayāmarut; do you, who are associated in the worship ofViṣṇudrive away, as warriors (scatter their enemies), our secret foes.

text.sanskrit: गंता नो यज्ञं यज्ञियाः सुशमि श्रोता हवमरक्ष एवयामरुत् ।ज्येष्ठासो न पर्वतासो व्योमनि यूयं तस्य प्रचेतसः स्यात दुर्धर्तवो निदः ॥
text.iast: ganta  naḥ  yajñam  yajñiyāḥ  su-śami  śrota  havam  arakṣaḥ  evayāmarut jyeṣṭhāsaḥ  na  parvatāsaḥ  ví-omani  yūyam  tasya  pra-cetasaḥ  syāta  duḥ-dhartavaḥ  nidaḥ ||

translations.text: AdorableMarutscome to our sacrifice, so that it may be prosperous; hear, undeterred byrākṣasas, the invocation of Evayāmarut; abiding like lofty mountains in mid-heaven, do you, who are profoundly wise, be ever intolerant of the reviler.
